revised_title: Scarborough Earthquake of 1737: An Eyewitness Account
tldr: In December 1737, an earthquake struck Scarborough, causing significant damage to the pier and surrounding area. The author, Maurice Johnson, provides a detailed account of the event, including the movement of the pier, the loss of the Spaw-water, and the lack of casualties. The eyewitness report is submitted for consideration by the Royal Society.
